Part b

handNote.desc: It is written in a good hand of the ixth cent.

msItem.title: Fragments of a Lectionary from the Old Testament, with troparia, prokeimena, etc., according to the Malkite use, comprising Lent, Palm Sunday and Passion Week.

item.p: Nineteen vellum leaves, about 8 ½ in. by 6 3/4, many of which are much soiled and mutilated. The quires are signed with letters. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 22 to 20 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of about the xith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

msItem.title: Portions of a Jacobite Lectionary from the Old and New Testaments for various festivals
msItem.note: Only the lessons from the Old Testament are given in full.
Some of the lessons from the Old Testament are according to the LXX.; e.g., fol. 38 b (Exodus, ch. xvii. 8—14).

msItem.title: The Epiphany
The Commemoration of the blessed Virgin
The Commemoration of S. John the Baptist
The Adoration of the holy Cross
The Washing of Feet

item.p: Vellum, about 8 5/8 in. by 6 1/4, consisting of 18 leaves (Add. 17,218, foll. 23—40), many of which are much stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters (fol. 39 b, ܟܕ). Each page is divided, into two columns, of from 28 to 34 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth or xth cent.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Visit of Mary to Elisabeth

item.p: Eleven vellum leaves, about 8 3/8 in. by 7 1/8, all more or less stained and mutilated (Add. 17,218, foll. 59—69). The quires are signed with letters (fol. 68 b, ܟܚ, by a later hand ܐ), and there are from 20 to 27 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth cent.

msItem.title: On purity of Soul
msItem.rubric: ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ̣ ܕܥܠ ܕܟܝܘܬܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܕܚ̣ܠܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܒܢܦܫܐ ܐܝܬܝܗ̣̇. ܡܓܕܠܐ ܡܚܣܢܐ܇ ܕܠܐ ܡܫܟܚܝܢ ܒܥ̈ܠܕܒܒܐ ܕܢܟܒ̣ܫܘܢܝܗܝ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.author: John the monk
msItem.title: On the New World
msItem.rubric: ܕܝܠܗ ܡܢ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܥܠܡܐ ܚܕܬܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐܣܬܟܠܘ ܪܚܡ̣ܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܕܠܘܬܟܘܢ ܐܘ ܒܢܝ̈ܢܫܐ.. ܚܙܘ ܪܒܘܬܐ ܕܣܒܪܐ ܕܝܗܒ̣ ܠܟܘܢ ܒܝܕ ܒܪܗ ܚܒܝܒܐ. ܏ܘܫ.The original description of this manuscript by William Wright includes characters, symbols, or illustrations which cannot be represented. Please consult the attached image.

item.p: Fourteen vellum leaves, about 9 1/8 in. by 6 1/4, the first of which is slightly stained and torn (Add. 17,218, foll. 70—83). The quires are signed with letters (fol. 70, ܝܘ; fol. 72, ܝܙ). Several leaves are wanting after fol. 70. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 26 to 31 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth cent.

msItem.title: An Exposition of the Order of the Celebration of the holy Eucharist
The end of the 2nd chapter
The beginning of the 3rd chapter
msItem.incipit: ܩܐܦܐܠܐܘܢ ܕܬ̈ܠܬܐ .. ܏ܡܛܠ ܏ܒܪܬ. ܏ܩܠܐ ܏ܗ̇ܝ ܏ܕܠܚܡܐ ܏ܫܡܝܢܐ. ܏ܩ̇ܨܝܢܢ܀ ܝܬܝܪܬܐ ܗܝ ܡܕܝܢ ܡܢ ܗܪܟܐ̇. ܘܕܠܝܬ ܢܩܝܦܘܬܐ ܡܐܠܠܘܢ̇. ܘܐܦ ܒܪܬ ܩܠܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܠܚܡܐ ܫܡܝܢܐ ܘܛܒܝܒܬܐ: ܕܠܐ ܝܕܝܥܐ ܠܐܝܟܐ ܡܬܡܠܠܐ. ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܠܘܬ ܐܒܐ ܪܒܐ ܒܙܢܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܨܠܘܬܐ. ܘܠܐ ܐܢ ܠܘܬ ܥܡܐ ܒܙܢܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܒܪܟܢܘܬܐ. ܐܠܐ ܐܝܟ ܕܡܢ ܠܐܣܟܘܠܐ ܡܕܡ ܘܠܐ ܡܠܚܡܘܬܐ̇. ܘܐܝܟ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܢܫ ܡ̇ܫܐܠ܇ ܠܘ ܠܚܕ ܟܗܢܐ ܐܠܐ ܠܣ̈ܓܝܐܐ̇. ܕܡܢܐ ܐܪܪܐ ܥ̇ܒܕܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ̇. ܘܡ̇ܦܢܝܢ ܕܠܚܡܐ ܫ̇ܡܝܢܐ ܩ̇ܨܝܢܢ. ܘܗܐ ܒܪܬ ܩܠܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܐܘܢܓܠܝܬܐ ܕܡܪܝܐ̇. ܐܝܟ ܟܝܬ ܕܡܣ̣ܬܒܪܐ̇. ܘܐܦܢ ܐܚܪܢܝܐܝܬ ܐܝܬ ܠܗ̇܇ ܒܪܡ ܕܝܢ ܠܘ ܕܘܟܬܗ̇ ܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܐܝܟ ܕܒܫܪܪܐ̇. ܗܕܐ ܕܒܗ̇ ܡܬܐܡܪܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: Two vellum leaves, about 9 1/4 in. by 6 1/2, with from 35 to 38 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth cent.

msItem.title: Unspecified contents
msItem.quote: ܡܢܐ ܏ܗܝ̣ ܏ܥܠܬܐ ܏ ܏ܕܡܐܬܝܬܗ ܏ܕܒܪܐ ܏ܕܐܠܗܐ . . . ܥܕܡܐ ܕܝܢ . . . ܒܛܝܒܘܬܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܫܠܡܢܢ ܟܕ ܣܝܟܝܢ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܦܥܠܘܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ ܒܬܠܬܝܢ ܘܐܪܒܥܐ ܫܘܐ̈ܠܐ ܘܗܠܝܢ ܬܘܒ ܒܕܒܗܢܐ ܕܬܪܬܝܢ ܥܕ ܗܫܐ ܐܟܬܒܢܢ ܬܫܥܣܪ. ܟܕ ܟܠܗ̇ ܡܟܬܒܢܘܬܐ ܕܫܘܐܠܐ ܕܥܬܝܩܬܐ ܠܬܪܬܝܢ ܡܢ̈ܘܢ ܡܬܦܠܓܐ ܡܢܗ̇ ܠܣܘܥܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܥܒܪܘܼ ܘܡܢܗ̇ ܬܘܒ ܠܓܠܝ̈ܢܐ ܘܠܡ̈ܠܐ ܟܕ ܐܦ ܗ̣ܢܘܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܐܢ ܣܘܥܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܥܒܪܘ ܘܐܢ ܓܠܝ̈ܢܐ ܘܡ̈ܠܐ ܕܐܬܚܙܝܘ ܠܢܒ̈ܝܐ ܒܘܕܩܐ ܗܘܘ ܘܪܡܙܐ ܥܠ ܣܘܥܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܥܬܝܕܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܠܡܬܓܡܪܘ ܒܡܐܬܝܬܗ ܕܡܚܝܢܢ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܥܕܡܐ ܓܝܪ ܠܗܫܐ ܣܘܥܪ̈ܢܐ ܘܓ̈ܠܝܢܐ ܛܠܠܐ ܗܘܘ ܕܡܚܘܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܥܠ ܓܘܫܡܐ ܕܐܬ̇ܐ ܒܬܪ ܛܠܠܐ. ܡܟܝܠ ܕܝܢ ܠܘ ܒܛܠܠܐ ܕܠܐ ܩܢܸܐ . . .

msItem.title: Letter of Abgar to our Lord, in an abridged form
msItem.note: CompareCureton, Ancient Syriac Documents, p.ܒand p. 2; andCowper, the Apocryphal Gospels, p. lxxxi. and p. 219.

item.p: The leaf is much soiled and torn.
It seems to have been one of the fly-leaves of a manuscript.

handNote.desc: The writing is a cursive character of about the10th century.

item.p:
Below, there is a note, stating that the book, of which this leaf formed part, belonged to oneLazarus of
Sauwarān (
nearHims):

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܠܥܙܪ ܒܪ ܢܝܚܐ (?)ܡܢ ܨܘܪܢ ܟܘܠ ܕܩܪܐ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܘܗܝ.

item.p: The writing on the verse is so much effaced that not a single line is wholly legible.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

msItem.title: A partially erased note, which states that this copy of the four Gospels, or of the whole New Testament, belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara

item.p: A vellum leaf, about 9 in. by 5 ¾.
A little below the partially erased note, we find a later note, which says that the number of those who received ordination from John, bishop of Tella , was 170,070

p.quote: ܗܘܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܚܘܫܒܢܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܩܒܠܘ ܟܝܪܘܛܘܢܝܐ ܡܢ ܐܦ܏ܝܣ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܕܬܠܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܡܐܐ ܘܫ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܐ̈ܠܦܝܢ. ܏ܘܥ.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.category: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesioastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
